title: The PowerVision PowerEgg drone looks like an alien ship out of Arrival | Trusted Reviews
description:
![PowerVision
PowerEgg](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

  * [CES](https://www.trustedreviews.com/tag/ces)

**The PowerVision PowerEgg shown off at[CES
2018](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/ces-2018-live-news-
highlights-3350586) is unlike any drone we’ve seen before.**

If you’ve seen Denis Villeneuve’s excellent sci-fi film _Arrival,_ you’ll be
familiar with the eery pods in which the extraterrestrial visitors, ahem,
arrive. They’re elongated egg-shaped vessels that stand like monoliths over
the landscape and which also make weird noises.

![PowerVision
PowerEgg](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

Well, when enclosed, the PowerVision PowerEgg looks just like one of those.
Things get a little more terrifying when it opens up to reveal its propeller
arms and four legs. It goes from _Arrival_ to looking like something from _The
War of the Worlds_.

**Related:[Best drones](https://www.trustedreviews.com/guide/best-drones)**

![PowerVision
PowerEgg](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

It’s a huge departure from the standard quadcopter designs you may have seen
from practically every other drone maker.

Once you look past its strange design, however, it does actually share many
features of other drones. It can record up to 4K resolution video and has a
3-axis gimbal for stabilisation. The camera can stream its video in 720p to
your paired smartphone and can transmit up to 5km away.

![PowerVision
PowerEgg](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

There’s a maximum flight speed of 46km/h and a flight time of around 23
minutes. Controls take the form of a standard twin-stick remote control or,
more interestingly, the Maestro, which is designed to be used one-handed and
looks a lot like an old Wii Nunchuk controller. The latter aims to simplify
flight controls and also supports gestures.

The PowerEgg is available now for $1288.

![PowerVision
PowerEgg](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

Away from the skies, PowerVision was also showing off the PowerDolphin. This
appears to be a more streamlined version of the
[PowerRay](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/powerray-underwater-drone-
thats-fishermans-friend-3277871) underwater drone I saw back at IFA. It’s
capable of 4K video and will let you drag bait too. The PowerDolphin will cost
$749 when it’s released in April.

**Would you head for the hills if you saw a PowerEgg in the skies? Let us know
on Facebook or Twitter.**
